intro: Medinilla cacuminum, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its pendant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and革质 (leathery) in texture.
